clinical_study.brief_title: Safety, Tolerability and Efficacy of Immunomodulation With AT-1501 in Islet Cell Transplantation
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability and Efficacy of Immunomodulation With AT-1501 in Adults With Type 1 Diabetes Undergoing Islet Cell Transplant

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the safety, tolerability and efficacy of AT-1501 in an immunomodulation regimen in adult patients with T1D undergoing an islet cell transplant.

detailed_description.textblock:
This study will evaluate the safety, tolerability and efficacy of AT-1501 in an immunomodulation regimen in adult patients with T1D undergoing an islet cell transplant. This study will also provide valuable data with respect to its potential additional uses in autoimmunity and solid organ transplant. This is a single arm open-label study and up to 6 participants will be recruited at a single center in Canada.
The objectives include:
- To assess the safety and tolerability of immunomodulation with AT-1501, in combination (AT+) with rabbit anti-thymoglobulin (ATG), etanercept and mycophenolate mofetil (MMF/EC-MPS) in adults with T1D undergoing islet cell transplant.
- To assess the efficacy of immunomodulation with AT-1501 in adults with T1D undergoing islet cell transplant.
The duration of treatment may vary from participant to participant and could be up to 20 months. Participants may receive up to 2 islet cell transplants.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety- Adverse Events (AE) and Adverse Events of Special Interest (AEoSI)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Accessed from date of transplant through 1 year post transplant for approximately 2 years
Days 75 , Day 365 post-first transplant, and final transplant and 1 year after discontinuation of AT-1501
primary_outcome.description: Change in the proportion of participants that become insulin independent at Days 75 and 365 post-first, and final transplant

secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of participants with graft failure

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy- Durability of insulin independence- long term
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 and 3 years after discontinuation of AT- 1501
secondary_outcome.description: Change in the proportion of participants that become insulin independent at year 2 and year 3

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 365 and free of serious hypoglycemic events from Day 28 to 365 post-first transplant
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of participants with HbA1c <7.0% (53 mmol/mol) and free of serious hypoglycemic events (SHEs) Proportion of participants with HbA1c ≤6.5% (48 mmol/mol) and free from SHEs

other_outcome.measure: Exploratory- Hypoglycemia unawareness (using the method of Clarke)
other_outcome.time_frame: Day 75, 365, and 1, 2 and 3 years after discontinuation of AT-1501
other_outcome.description: Proportion of participants with hypoglycemia unawareness

other_outcome.time_frame: Day 75, 365, and 1, 2 and 3 years after discontinuation of AT-1501
other_outcome.description: Change in glycemic lability using CGMS- Continuous Glucose Monitoring System

other_outcome.time_frame: Day 75, 365, and 1, 2 and 3 years after discontinuation of AT-1501
other_outcome.description: Change in glycemic variability using CGMS- Continuous Glucose Monitoring System

other_outcome.measure: Exploratory- biomarkers of tissue damage and inflammation

other_outcome.time_frame: T=0 (pre infusion), 1 (end of infusion), 2, 4, 8, 12, 24 and 48 hrs.
T=0 (pre infusion), 1 (end of infusion), 2, 4, 8, 12, 24 and 48 hrs.
T=0 (pre infusion), 1 (end of infusion), 2, 4, 8, 12, 24 and 48 hrs.
T=0 (pre infusion), 1 (end of infusion), 2, 4, 8, 12, 24 and 48 hrs.
T=0 (pre infusion), 1 (end of infusion), 2, 4, 8, 12, 24 and 48 hrs.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Men and women 18-65 years of age
2. A diagnosis of T1D ≥5 years with onset of disease at <40 years of age
3. Involvement in intensive diabetes management as directed by an endocrinologist or diabetologist with at least 3 clinical evaluations within the 12 months prior to Screening; using an insulin pump or multiple daily injection (MDI) insulin therapy; and, unable to achieve acceptable metabolic control because of the occurrence of severe hypoglycemia
4. At least 2 unexplained SHEs not secondary to a missed meal or dosing error, etc., in the 12 months prior to Screening
5. Glycosylated hemoglobin (HbA1c) level greater than 7% (53 mmol/mol) and less than 9.5% (80 mmol/mol) inclusive
6. Absence of stimulated C peptide (< 0.3 ng/mL) in response to a mixed meal tolerance test (MMTT) measured at 60 and 90 minutes after the start of consumption
7. Reduced awareness of hypoglycemia as defined by a Clarke Score [Clarke 1995] of 4 or more at the time of Screening, during the Screening period and within the last 6 months prior to the transplant
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Any previous transplant
2. HbA1c level less than 7% (53 mmol/mol)
